# Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r, include=FALSE}
packages <- list("data.table","ggplot2", "quantmod", "forecast","prophet",
                 "tidymodels", "lubridate", "tidyquant", "shiny", "plotly")
lapply(packages, require, character.only = T)
library(ggplot2)
```

You can add options to executable code like this


```{r}
inputPanel(
  shiny::textInput("stock", "Select Stock", "PG")
)
```

```{r}
#| context: server

library(data.table)
library(tidyquant)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)
output$value <- renderText({ input$stock })

selectedData <- reactive({
  
    dt_stock <- data.table(tq_get(input$stock, get = "stock.prices", from = "2018-01-01"))
  })

output$distPlot <- renderPlotly({
  
  g <- ggplot(data = selectedData(), aes(x = date, y = close)) +
    geom_line() + theme_tq()
  ggplotly(g)

})
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
